result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerry Jerome Ball was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jerry Jerome Ball in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Presentence Investigation reviewed.  Statements by state, defense and defendant.   
  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to Count 1 in 15CF380, with credit for 6 days time served.  Court orders the defendant to pay all costs, assessments and surcharges, submit DNA and pay costs.
Bail on deposit to be applied and any balance due and owing is to be paid during  Extended Supervision in 15CF380 and non-payment will result in civil judgment.
Defendant given firearm admonition and voting prohibition.
Filed: CR-233, Pretrial Credit
Sentencing hearing on September 25, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Jerry Jerome Ball in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for Nick Heitman for the State of Wisconsin.The court will adjourn matter so that the state may be fully prepared to proceed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Received and Filed, PSI Report.
Received and Filed, PSI Report.

Defendant Jerry Jerome Ball in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
AS TO CHARGE: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead NO CONTEST. Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 38 on 8-21-2015 at 8:15 am.  Presentence Report requested by defense counsel.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.  Court vacates the Jury Trial date of 7-20-2015 at 8:30 am, Branch 4.   mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld

Defendant Jerry Jerome Ball in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Upon the motion of the State, with no objection by defense counsel, Court ordered the following cases consolidated for the purposes of trial:  Cases 2015CF380 and 2015CF1508.  All available discovery turned over to defense counsel per the State.  Outstanding discovery is a squad cam video.  Court ordered case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 6-25-2015 at 8:30 am and Jury Trial on 7-20-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld

04-08-15

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Monique B.

Defendant Jerry Jerome Ball in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Jerry Jerome Ball in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk. 
 Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
